heading: 1.10 Our First Dataset: The Palmer Penguins
text: three penguin species Palmer Archipelago, Allison Horst
code:
library(palmerpenguins)
penguins## # A tibble: 344 × 8
##    species island    bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g
##    <fct>   <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <int>       <int>
##  1 Adelie  Torgersen           39.1          18.7               181        3750
##  2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4               186        3800
##  3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18                 195        3250
##  4 Adelie  Torgersen           NA            NA                  NA          NA
##  5 Adelie  Torgersen           36.7          19.3               193        3450
##  6 Adelie  Torgersen           39.3          20.6               190        3650
##  7 Adelie  Torgersen           38.9          17.8               181        3625
##  8 Adelie  Torgersen           39.2          19.6               195        4675
##  9 Adelie  Torgersen           34.1          18.1               193        3475
## 10 Adelie  Torgersen           42            20.2               190        4250
## # … with 334 more rows, and 2 more variables: sex <fct>, year <int>

heading: 1.11 The Grammar of Graphics: Translate data into visualizations
text:
grammar means:
can build complex visualizations
basic building blocks
fit together acording 
rules (grammar)
grammar means:can build complex visualizations
basic building blocks
fit together acording 
rules (grammar)just like legojust like legolearn building blocks 
different function 
different types plots
(e.g. barplot, scatterplot, lineplot,
piechart)learn building blocks 
different function 
different types plots
(e.g. barplot, scatterplot, lineplot,
piechart)build plot ground upbuild plot ground updatadataaesthetic mappingaesthetic mappinggeom(s)geom(s)(stat(s))(stat(s))coordinate systemcoordinate systemguidesguidesscalesscalesthemethemesaving plotsget rid NA -> next week
code:
library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)

penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(flipper_length_mm, bill_length_mm,
             color = species,
             shape = sex)) +
  geom_point(size = 2.5) +
  geom_smooth(aes(group = species), method = "lm", se = FALSE,
              show.legend = FALSE) +
  labs(x = "Flipper length [mm]",
       y = "Bill length [mm]",
       title = "Penguins!",
       subtitle = "The 3 penguin species can be differentiated by their flipper- and bill-lengths.",
       caption = "Datasource:\nHorst AM, Hill AP, Gorman KB (2020). palmerpenguins:\nPalmer Archipelago (Antarctica) penguin data.\nR package version 0.1.0. https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/",
       color = "Species",
       shape = "Sex") +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_color_brewer(type = "qual") +
  theme(plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0))
theme_set(theme_minimal())


my_plot <- ggplot(penguins, aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = bill_length_mm,
                     shape = sex, color = species)) +
  geom_point() +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("red", "blue", "orange")) +
  labs(title = "Penguins") +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(colour = "purple"))

my_plot 
ggsave("my_plot.png", my_plot)

heading: 2.2 Reading Data with readr
text:
download data todayshow folder structureshowing raw datadownload.file (make sure data folder exists)show tab / ctrl+space autocompletionread gapminder data (csv)read csv also works url
probably also want local copy
write_csv friends
probably also want local copywrite_csv friendsView ctrl+click
code:
read_csv("data/02/gapminder.csv")## # A tibble: 1,704 × 6
##    country     continent  year lifeExp      pop gdpPercap
##    <chr>       <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
##  1 Afghanistan Asia       1952    28.8  8425333      779.
##  2 Afghanistan Asia       1957    30.3  9240934      821.
##  3 Afghanistan Asia       1962    32.0 10267083      853.
##  4 Afghanistan Asia       1967    34.0 11537966      836.
##  5 Afghanistan Asia       1972    36.1 13079460      740.
##  6 Afghanistan Asia       1977    38.4 14880372      786.
##  7 Afghanistan Asia       1982    39.9 12881816      978.
##  8 Afghanistan Asia       1987    40.8 13867957      852.
##  9 Afghanistan Asia       1992    41.7 16317921      649.
## 10 Afghanistan Asia       1997    41.8 22227415      635.
## # … with 1,694 more rows
download.file("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jmbuhr/dataintro/main/data/02/gapminder.csv", "example-download.csv")
our_data <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jmbuhr/dataintro/main/data/02/gapminder.csv")

write_csv(our_data, "our-data.csv")

project based workflowgetwdwhy use setwdwhat file-paths
absolute

heading: 2.3.1 Common Hurdles when Importing Data
text:
csv vs csv2read_lines 
_tsv, obscure_file
_tsv, obscure_fileread_delim_messierwhat parsing?excel files?
note :: library
note :: library
code:
read_csv2("data/02/gapminder_csv2.csv")## # A tibble: 1,704 × 6
##    country     continent  year lifeExp      pop gdpPercap
##    <chr>       <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
##  1 Afghanistan Asia       1952    28.8  8425333      779.
##  2 Afghanistan Asia       1957    30.3  9240934      821.
##  3 Afghanistan Asia       1962    32.0 10267083      853.
##  4 Afghanistan Asia       1967    34.0 11537966      836.
##  5 Afghanistan Asia       1972    36.1 13079460      740.
##  6 Afghanistan Asia       1977    38.4 14880372      786.
##  7 Afghanistan Asia       1982    39.9 12881816      978.
##  8 Afghanistan Asia       1987    40.8 13867957      852.
##  9 Afghanistan Asia       1992    41.7 16317921      649.
## 10 Afghanistan Asia       1997    41.8 22227415      635.
## # … with 1,694 more rows
read_lines("data/02/gapminder_tsv.txt", n_max = 3)## [1] "country\tcontinent\tyear\tlifeExp\tpop\tgdpPercap"    
## [2] "Afghanistan\tAsia\t1952\t28.801\t8425333\t779.4453145"
## [3] "Afghanistan\tAsia\t1957\t30.332\t9240934\t820.8530296"
# read_tsv()
read_delim("data/02/obscure_file.tsv", "~")## # A tibble: 1,704 × 6
##    country     continent  year lifeExp      pop gdpPercap
##    <chr>       <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>

##  4 Afghanistan Asia       1967    34.0 11537966      836.
##  5 Afghanistan Asia       1972    36.1 13079460      740.
##  6 Afghanistan Asia       1977    38.4 14880372      786.
##  7 Afghanistan Asia       1982    39.9 12881816      978.
##  8 Afghanistan Asia       1987    40.8 13867957      852.
##  9 Afghanistan Asia       1992    41.7 16317921      649.
## 10 Afghanistan Asia       1997    41.8 22227415      635.
## # … with 1,694 more rows
read_lines("data/02/gapminder_messier.csv", n_max = 5)## [1] "# Some comment about the data"                   
## [2] "And maybe a personal note"                       
## [3] "country,continent,year,lifeExp,pop,gdpPercap"    
## [4] "Afghanistan,Asia,1952,28.801,8425333,779.4453145"
## [5] "Afghanistan,Asia,1957,30.332,9240934,820.8530296"
read_csv("data/02/gapminder_messier.csv", skip = 2)## # A tibble: 1,704 × 6
##    country     continent  year lifeExp      pop gdpPercap

heading: 2.4 Wrangling Data with dplyr
text: Let’s go data wrangling! Artwork Allison Horst

heading: 2.4.1 select
text: …column names, : , starts_with, see select_helpers, c(…)
code:
select(gapminder, country, year, gdpPercap)## # A tibble: 1,704 × 3
##    country      year gdpPercap
##    <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl>
##  1 Afghanistan  1952      779.
##  2 Afghanistan  1957      821.
##  3 Afghanistan  1962      853.
##  4 Afghanistan  1967      836.
##  5 Afghanistan  1972      740.
##  6 Afghanistan  1977      786.
##  7 Afghanistan  1982      978.
##  8 Afghanistan  1987      852.
##  9 Afghanistan  1992      649.
## 10 Afghanistan  1997      635.
## # … with 1,694 more rows
select(gapminder, year:pop)## # A tibble: 1,704 × 3
##     year lifeExp      pop
##    <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
##  1  1952    28.8  8425333
##  2  1957    30.3  9240934
##  3  1962    32.0 10267083
##  4  1967    34.0 11537966
##  5  1972    36.1 13079460
##  6  1977    38.4 14880372
##  7  1982    39.9 12881816
##  8  1987    40.8 13867957
##  9  1992    41.7 16317921
## 10  1997    41.8 22227415
## # … with 1,694 more rows
select(gapminder, starts_with("co"))## # A tibble: 1,704 × 2
##    country     continent
##    <chr>       <chr>    
##  1 Afghanistan Asia     
##  2 Afghanistan Asia     
##  3 Afghanistan Asia     
##  4 Afghanistan Asia     
##  5 Afghanistan Asia     
##  6 Afghanistan Asia     
##  7 Afghanistan Asia     
##  8 Afghanistan Asia     
##  9 Afghanistan Asia     
## 10 Afghanistan Asia     
## # … with 1,694 more rows
select(gapminder, where(is.numeric))## # A tibble: 1,704 × 4
##     year lifeExp      pop gdpPercap
##    <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
##  1  1952    28.8  8425333      779.
##  2  1957    30.3  9240934      821.
##  3  1962    32.0 10267083      853.
##  4  1967    34.0 11537966      836.
##  5  1972    36.1 13079460      740.
##  6  1977    38.4 14880372      786.
##  7  1982    39.9 12881816      978.
##  8  1987    40.8 13867957      852.
##  9  1992    41.7 16317921      649.
## 10  1997    41.8 22227415      635.
## # … with 1,694 more rows
select(gapminder, where(is.character))## # A tibble: 1,704 × 2
##    country     continent
##    <chr>       <chr>    
##  1 Afghanistan Asia     
##  2 Afghanistan Asia     
##  3 Afghanistan Asia

heading: 2.4.2 filter
text: Filter data. Artwork Allison Horstconditions e.g. year, country
code:
filter(gapminder, year > 2000, country == "New Zealand")## # A tibble: 2 × 6
##   country     continent  year lifeExp     pop gdpPercap
##   <chr>       <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>
## 1 New Zealand Oceania    2002    79.1 3908037    23190.
## 2 New Zealand Oceania    2007    80.2 4115771    25185.
filter(gapminder, year > 2000, str_to_lower(country) == "new zealand")## # A tibble: 2 × 6
##   country     continent  year lifeExp     pop gdpPercap
##   <chr>       <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>
## 1 New Zealand Oceania    2002    79.1 3908037    23190.
## 2 New Zealand Oceania    2007    80.2 4115771    25185.
filter(gapminder, country == "New Zealand" | country == "Afghanistan")## # A tibble: 24 × 6
##    country     continent  year lifeExp      pop gdpPercap
##    <chr>       <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
##  1 Afghanistan Asia       1952    28.8  8425333      779.
##  2 Afghanistan Asia       1957    30.3  9240934      821.
##  3 Afghanistan Asia       1962    32.0 10267083      853.
##  4 Afghanistan Asia       1967    34.0 11537966      836.
##  5 Afghanistan Asia       1972    36.1 13079460      740.
##  6 Afghanistan Asia       1977    38.4 14880372      786.
##  7 Afghanistan Asia       1982    39.9 12881816      978.
##  8 Afghanistan Asia       1987    40.8 13867957      852.
##  9 Afghanistan Asia       1992    41.7 16317921      649.
## 10 Afghanistan Asia       1997    41.8 22227415      635.
## # … with 14 more rows
filter(gapminder, country %in% c("New Zealand", "Afghanistan"))## # A tibble: 24 × 6
##    country     continent  year lifeExp      pop gdpPercap
##    <chr>       <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
##  1 Afghanistan Asia       1952    28.8  8425333      779.
##  2 Afghanistan Asia       1957    30.3  9240934      821.
##  3 Afghanistan Asia       1962    32.0 10267083      853.
##  4 Afghanistan Asia       1967    34.0 11537966      836.
##  5 Afghanistan Asia       1972    36.1 13079460      740.
##  6 Afghanistan Asia       1977    38.4 14880372      786.
##  7 Afghanistan Asia       1982    39.9 12881816      978.
##  8 Afghanistan Asia       1987    40.8 13867957      852.
##  9 Afghanistan Asia       1992    41.7 16317921      649.
## 10 Afghanistan Asia       1997    41.8 22227415      635.
## # … with 14 more rows

heading: 2.4.3 mutate
text: calculate gdpnote assignment

gapminder## # A tibble: 1,704 × 7
##    country     continent  year lifeExp      pop gdpPercap          gdp
##    <chr>       <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>        <dbl>
##  1 Afghanistan Asia       1952    28.8  8425333      779.  6567086330.

##  6 Afghanistan Asia       1977    38.4 14880372      786. 11697659231.
##  7 Afghanistan Asia       1982    39.9 12881816      978. 12598563401.
##  8 Afghanistan Asia       1987    40.8 13867957      852. 11820990309.
##  9 Afghanistan Asia       1992    41.7 16317921      649. 10595901589.
## 10 Afghanistan Asia       1997    41.8 22227415      635. 14121995875.
## # … with 1,694 more rows

heading: 2.4.4 Interlude: Begind the magic, handling data with base-R
text: even dataframes / tibbles?tibbleget elements vectorget elements tibbleget elements list
code:
test_tibble <- tibble(
  x = 1:5,
  y = x ^ 2,
  z = c("hello", "world", "test", "four", "five")
)
test_tibble## # A tibble: 5 × 3
##       x     y z    
##   <int> <dbl> <chr>
## 1     1     1 hello
## 2     2     4 world
## 3     3     9 test 
## 4     4    16 four 
## 5     5    25 five
test_tibble[c(1, 3)]## # A tibble: 5 × 2
##       x z    
##   <int> <chr>
## 1     1 hello
## 2     2 world
## 3     3 test 
## 4     4 four 
## 5     5 five
test_tibble[c("x", "z")]## # A tibble: 5 × 2
##       x z    
##   <int> <chr>
## 1     1 hello
## 2     2 world
## 3     3 test 
## 4     4 four 
## 5     5 five
test_tibble[1, c(1, 2)]## # A tibble: 1 × 2
##       x     y
##   <int> <dbl>
## 1     1     1
test_tibble$x## [1] 1 2 3 4 5
test_tibble[[1]]## [1] 1 2 3 4 5
pull(test_tibble, x)## [1] 1 2 3 4 5
x <- 1:10
x[1] <- 42
x##  [1] 42  2  3  4  5  6  7  8  9 10

heading: 2.4.5 The pipe %>%
text: performing one stepcompare ggplot +basic tidyverse functions take data first argumentreading code headnote |>Ctrl+Shift+M
code:
subset_gapminder <- select(gapminder, country, year, pop)
filtered_gapminder <- filter(subset_gapminder, year > 200)
final_gapminder <- mutate(filtered_gapminder, pop_thousands = pop / 1000)
final_gapminder## # A tibble: 1,704 × 4
##    country      year      pop pop_thousands
##    <chr>       <dbl>    <dbl>         <dbl>
##  1 Afghanistan  1952  8425333         8425.
##  2 Afghanistan  1957  9240934         9241.
##  3 Afghanistan  1962 10267083        10267.
##  4 Afghanistan  1967 11537966        11538.
##  5 Afghanistan  1972 13079460        13079.
##  6 Afghanistan  1977 14880372        14880.
##  7 Afghanistan  1982 12881816        12882.
##  8 Afghanistan  1987 13867957        13868.
##  9 Afghanistan  1992 16317921        16318.
## 10 Afghanistan  1997 22227415        22227.
## # … with 1,694 more rows
final_gapminder <- gapminder %>% 
  select(country, year, pop) %>% 
  filter(year > 2000) %>% 
  mutate(pop_thousands = pop / 1000)

final_gapminder## # A tibble: 284 × 4
##    country      year      pop pop_thousands
##    <chr>       <dbl>    <dbl>         <dbl>
##  1 Afghanistan  2002 25268405        25268.
##  2 Afghanistan  2007 31889923        31890.
##  3 Albania      2002  3508512         3509.
##  4 Albania      2007  3600523         3601.
##  5 Algeria      2002 31287142        31287.
##  6 Algeria      2007 33333216        33333.
##  7 Angola       2002 10866106        10866.
##  8 Angola       2007 12420476        12420.
##  9 Argentina    2002 38331121        38331.
## 10 Argentina    2007 40301927        40302.
## # … with 274 more rows

heading: 2.4.7 summarise
code:
gapminder %>% 
  summarise(
    max_year = min(year),
    pop = max(pop),
    mean_life_expectancy = mean(lifeExp)
  )## # A tibble: 1 × 3
##   max_year        pop mean_life_expectancy
##      <dbl>      <dbl>                <dbl>
## 1     1952 1318683096                 59.5

heading: 2.4.8 group_by
code:
gapminder %>% 
  group_by(year) %>% 
  summarise(
    mean(lifeExp)
  )## # A tibble: 12 × 2
##     year `mean(lifeExp)`
##    <dbl>           <dbl>
##  1  1952            49.1
##  2  1957            51.5
##  3  1962            53.6
##  4  1967            55.7
##  5  1972            57.6
##  6  1977            59.6
##  7  1982            61.5
##  8  1987            63.2
##  9  1992            64.2
## 10  1997            65.0
## 11  2002            65.7
## 12  2007            67.0
gapminder %>% 
  group_by(year, continent) %>% 
  summarise(
    mean(lifeExp)
  ) %>%
  ungroup()## # A tibble: 60 × 3
##     year continent `mean(lifeExp)`
##    <dbl> <chr>               <dbl>
##  1  1952 Africa               39.1
##  2  1952 Americas             53.3
##  3  1952 Asia                 46.3
##  4  1952 Europe               64.4
##  5  1952 Oceania              69.3
##  6  1957 Africa               41.3
##  7  1957 Americas             56.0
##  8  1957 Asia                 49.3
##  9  1957 Europe               66.7
## 10  1957 Oceania              70.3
## # … with 50 more rows
gapminder %>% 
  group_by(year) %>%
  mutate(pop = pop / sum(pop))## # A tibble: 1,704 × 7
## # Groups:   year [12]
##    country     continent  year lifeExp     pop gdpPercap          gdp
##    <chr>       <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>        <dbl>

##  2 Afghanistan Asia       1957    30.3 0.00347      821.  7585448670.
##  3 Afghanistan Asia       1962    32.0 0.00354      853.  8758855797.
##  4 Afghanistan Asia       1967    34.0 0.00359      836.  9648014150.
##  5 Afghanistan Asia       1972    36.1 0.00366      740.  9678553274.
##  6 Afghanistan Asia       1977    38.4 0.00379      786. 11697659231.
##  7 Afghanistan Asia       1982    39.9 0.00300      978. 12598563401.
##  8 Afghanistan Asia       1987    40.8 0.00296      852. 11820990309.
##  9 Afghanistan Asia       1992    41.7 0.00319      649. 10595901589.
## 10 Afghanistan Asia       1997    41.8 0.00403      635. 14121995875.
## # … with 1,694 more rows

heading: 2.5 Visualization and our first encounter with factors
text: life expectancy timelife expectancy timecontrolling order thingscontrolling order thingsfct_fct_fct_relevelfct_releveladd color plotadd color plotheadheadnamed vectors!named vectors!pull $pull $
code:
gapminder %>% 
  ggplot(aes(year, lifeExp, group = country)) +
  geom_line() +
  facet_wrap(~continent)
gapminder %>% 
  ggplot(aes(year, lifeExp, color = country)) +
  geom_line() +
  facet_wrap(~continent) +
  guides(color = "none")
gapminder %>% 
  mutate(continent = fct_relevel(continent, c("Oceania"))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(year, lifeExp, color = country)) +
  geom_line() +
  facet_wrap(~continent) +
  guides(color = "none")
animals <- c("cat", "dog", "bear")
animals <- factor(animals, levels = c("cat", "dog"), ordered = TRUE)
country_colors <- read_csv("data/02/country_colors.csv")
country_colors## # A tibble: 142 × 2
##    country          color  
##    <chr>            <chr>  
##  1 Nigeria          #7F3B08
##  2 Egypt            #833D07
##  3 Ethiopia         #873F07
##  4 Congo, Dem. Rep. #8B4107
##  5 South Africa     #8F4407
##  6 Sudan            #934607
##  7 Tanzania         #974807
##  8 Kenya            #9B4A06
##  9 Morocco          #9F4D06
## 10 Algeria          #A34F06
## # … with 132 more rows
x <- c(first = 1, second = 3, hello = 5)
x["first"]## first 
##     1
color <- country_colors$color
names(color) <- country_colors$country
head(color)##          Nigeria            Egypt         Ethiopia Congo, Dem. Rep. 
##        "#7F3B08"        "#833D07"        "#873F07"        "#8B4107" 
##     South Africa            Sudan 
##        "#8F4407"        "#934607"
gapminder %>% 
  mutate(continent = fct_relevel(continent, c("Oceania"))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(year, lifeExp, color = country)) +
  geom_line() +
  facet_wrap(~continent) +
  guides(color = "none") +
  scale_color_manual(values = color)
